TextBody:
Hello Swaroop,

Can you please let me know if this issue is still occurring for the computers after the agent is updated to the latest version.
If so, please let me know if we can schedule a meeting in order to try to reproduce the issue on a test machine.

Thank you,
Emil

			CGBANNERINDICATOR
			
		
	


Hello Swaroop,

Let me know if we can schedule a remote session in order to try to install the latest EPP Client on one of the machines.
I will ask one of the engineers to join our meeting so we can investigate what happens when the new agent is installed.

We can use a test machine or a VM so if the drive gets corrupted you will not lose anything from the machine. 

Best regards,
Emil

So, it is better we perform the testing on any spare laptop.

 

Regards,

Sandhya Sudhakara

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #418773 - - Windows endpoint 6.2.2.2005 is causing the issues to windows OS [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Ekkfl:ref ]



 

Hi Swaroop,

 

As we will effectively have to “break a device” we will need someone with a secondary laptop to run through this.

 

@Kodhandapani K,  @Saikiran Ampati are you able to assist? We will need to delete the .msi cache for the old client that’s installed and replicate the behavior. We could try this on a VM but I’m not sure if the user experience would be the same.

 

A member of the  @DT-CSE-SCCM-Intune team will need to be part of the call as they are handling the packaging and deployment of this application currently.

 

 


Warm Regards,

_____________________________________________

Cristhian Prieto Bayarlia

As my colleagues said, there is a very small chance that the EPP Client could cause this.
They recommended to have a remote session on a test machine where we can try to install the new agent one more time.

Please let me know your availability for Tuesday in order to schedule a remote session so we can try to reproduce the issue.

Thank you,
Emil
